did.abstract: Member of the Ann Arbor Township Planning Commission; minutes, correspondence, maps and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by the Ann Arbor Kiwanis Club (donor no.8712) in April 1998.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., James Morgan Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: James Morgan was a resident of Ann Arbor Township and a member of the Ann Arbor Township Planning Commission.

scopecontent.p: The James Morgan Papers include minutes, correspondence, maps and photographs. The collection is organized in three series: Ann Arbor Township Planning Commission, Personal, and Photographs.
The Ann Arbor Township Planning Commission series contains minutes, correspondence and maps relating to the commission's activities in the late 1970s and 1980s.

did.unittitle: Solent Acres, Ann Arbor Township; Planning Maps, 1949-1983

scopecontent.p: The Personal series contains a memorial notice for William Morgan and a letter written by James and Margaret Morgan.

did.unittitle: Personal letter and William Morgan memorial notice, 1960-1961

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series consists two folders of photographs taken or collected by James Morgan. The first folder contains photographs of Morgan's home, family, and vacations, probably in Northern Michigan. The second folder contains several tintype family portraits, a photograph of the Oscar Lamkin Meat Market in Lodi, Michigan, a photograph of an unidentified group of workers in a rail yard, and an unidentified photograph of a student musical revue.
